subject: Re: Problems testing an InputStream
msgSnippet: I am having a similar problem to the one in this thread. Chad, did you have any luck with getting your test to work? My scenario is that I have an xml file

I am having a similar problem to the one in this thread.  

Chad, did you have any luck with getting your test to work?

My scenario is that I have an xml file that is inside a jar.  When I
run the unit test inside Eclipse the file is found and the tests run
fine.  I even tried removing the jar from Eclipse's build path to make
sure it was not finding the file in some other location.  The test
failed without the jar in the path, so I am pretty sure the unit test
is finding the file in the jar.

Now, when I run the unit tests from ANT I get a NullPointerException
because the InputStream is Null.  I double checked the classpath that
is printed out when the unit test runs and the jar file that contains
the xml file is on the classpath.

Here is the code I am using to read in the xml file.  It is pretty
much the same as the original poster.

// Get our sample input file.
InputStream is = Class.class.getResourceAsStream("/RunPOEngineTest.xml");
InputStreamReader sr = new InputStreamReader(is);

Any insight would be appreciated.  Is there some known differences
with running Unit test in Eclipse vs. ANT that could be tripping me up.

Thanks,

Craig




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Chad Woolley <lists@t...> wrote:
> Hello,
> 
> I am writing a test related to XML parsing.  In the setUp() of my
test, I read 
> an InputStream as follows:
> 
>    inputStream = this.getClass().getResourceAsStream("sample.xml");
> 
> ...where sample.xml is in the same directory as my TestCase.
> 
> I then have a "sanity" check test to make sure I read the
InputStream correctly:
> 
>    public void testSampleInputStreamIsValid() {
>      assertNotNull("InputStream should not be null", inputStream);
>    }
> 
> When I run this from within my IDE (Eclipse), it works fine -
whether I run the 
> test directly, or from a suite (which is in another package).
> 
> HOWEVER, whenever I run it from Ant or Maven, I get a failure
(InputStream is null).
> 
> This is probably a basic question related to reading InputStreams,
but I'm not 
> sure what is wrong.  Hopefully someone can help, or refer me to some
helpful 
> documentation.
> 
> Thanks,
> Chad
